channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 19 Winter Olympic storylines we're watching (they're not just about sports)
item.description: The Winter Olympics promise plenty of high adrenaline, fierce competition, historic firsts and emotional moments over 2 1/2 weeks. Here are some of th...

item.title: Kilmar Abrego Garcia becomes symbol of mistaken deportations
item.description: Immigration lawyers said Kilmar Abrego Garcia's landmark case highlights the pitfalls with the speed and scale of the Trump administration's goal of m...

item.title: Energy Star has emerged stronger after Trump's EPA tried to end it
item.description: The Trump administration tried to end or privatize the government Energy Star efficiency program. But now Trump has signed a budget bill that fully fu...

item.title: 5 papers from the Super Bowl of Economics
item.description: Planet Money went to the annual meeting of the American Economics Association, and we saw some fascinating papers presented there.

item.title: I thought I'd heard my dad's voice for the last time. A movie helped me find it again
item.description: A period drama, a Supreme Court case and voice our film critic hadn't heard in decades.

item.title: Russian hits Ukraine energy sites in 'most powerful blow' so far this year
item.description: The attack - which reportedly consisted of more than 70 missiles and 450 drones - comes after a so-called "energy truce" expired at the weekend.

item.title: Voice behind Three Dog Night's "Joy to the World," Chuck Negron, dies at 83
item.description: Chuck Negron, a founding member of Three Dog Night whose lead vocals powered a string of hits for one of the top rock acts of the late 1960s and early...

item.title: Paris prosecutors raid France offices of Elon Musk's X
item.description: The Paris prosecutor says its cyber-crime unit is conducting a search of X's offices.

item.title: X office in Paris searched as prosecutor summons Musk for questioning
item.description: French officials search X's office in Paris and ask Elon Musk to answer questions about the platform amid a probe into its algorithms and AI functions...

item.title: Fifa president 'infantile' for wanting to lift Russia ban, Ukraine minister says
item.description: Ukraine's sports minister calls Fifa president Gianni Infantino "irresponsible" and "infantile" for saying it will look at lifting a ban on Russia.

item.title: Rape trial begins for son of Norway's crown princess in tense moment for royal family
item.description: Marius Borg Høiby is accused of 38 charges including four counts of rape in one of the biggest cases in Norway for years.

item.title: Don Lemon says he offered to turn himself in but agents were sent for him
item.description: Don Lemon says he offered to turn himself in to face charges over his coverage of a protest at a church but federal agents were sent for him anyway.

item.title: Boy swims 2.5 miles to save family swept out to sea: "Superhuman"
item.description: "The waves are massive and I have no life jacket on. … I just kept thinking 'just keep swimming, just keep swimming,'" Austin Appelbee said.

item.title: Hennepin County, Minnesota sheriff says she feels "scapegoated" by feds
item.description: The Hennepin County sheriff is considering whether to notify ICE before releasing people accused of the "worst of the worst" crimes — murder, rape and...

item.title: Air India grounds Boeing jet after pilot flags possible fuel control switch defect
item.description: The grounding comes amid an investigation into a crash last year involving an aircraft of the same model.

item.title: Judge blocks Trump administration from ending protections for Haitians
Trump’s $45 billion expansion of immigrant detention sites faces pushback from communities
item.description: State and local officials are pushing back against federal plans to expand immigrant detention facilities.

item.title: Authorities believe ‘Today’ show host Savannah Guthrie’s mother was taken against her will
